column4: Hello, anybody can help with with US Robotics Sportster Flash 56k modem (serial) which stopped working iN Feisty?
what did you already try?
I've tried using wvdial instead of gnome-ppp, turning carrier-detection off and playing with gnome-pp options
have you looked deeper already?
it actually connects but randomly stops working (no activity, but still connected)
are you sure the serial port is working?
Well yes, it is perfectly working on Windows XP (I'm on XP now) and worked great on Edgy
it disconnects often just on Feisty
I meant in linux. Module loaded, does it show up in dmesg, etc.
yes, but wait i'll double check
i just get serial8250: ttyS0 at I/O 0x3f8 (irq = 4) is a 16550A
is backfish a robot?
in my dmesg file
nothing else regarding modem or serial port
that looks good
is it an external serial modem?
Perpetual: yes it is. Us Robotics Sportster Flash
ok, have you tried using it with minicom?
Perpetual: no (I dont' know if I already told you, but modem works, just stops sending/receiving packets VERY often)
as a way to debug, of course
Perpetual: and doesn't disconnect
Perpetual: ah, is there any Guide or wiki ? ... googling for it
well, you need to find out at what level things go wrong
might be at OSI level 1
